timeline.bodyText: Any reason to keep the README untouched?
timeline.author: npepinpe
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,48 @@
+# [Atomix][Website]

replies.bodyText: No. I just kept it since it gives us a bit a clue what the project was and where it comes from, but I can also remove it if you insist.
replies.author: Zelldon

replies.bodyText: We could have a README that explains what this is - a hard fork of Atomix, why we decided to hard fork it, etc. - and link back to it. But as it is, to me this is a proper project README, so it seems strange to have that in Zeebe 😅
replies.author: npepinpe

timeline.bodyText: We can either remove or partially merge this would our global .gitignore
timeline.author: npepinpe

replies.bodyText: The thing is it also called before the super but it was not explicit. If you inherit a method then you will call it before calling methods from outer scope. If you want to call LocalProxySession#decode you need to write. LocalProxySession.this.decode()
